noun.description: (on a bridle) a simple bit, typically a jointed one, used with a single set of reins.

verb.description: Take (something) for oneself, typically quickly or without permission.
examples: shall we snaffle some of Bernard's sherry?

origin: Mid 16th century (denoting a bridle bit): probably from Low German or Dutch; compare with Middle Low German, Middle Dutch snavel beak, mouth. The verb (mid 19th century) is perhaps a different word.
